metadata.synopsis: Note: OOM is moved to separate dialogMinsc confronts Nine-Fingers after their temporary truce until the Zhent were defeated. He means to kill her, but she tries to convince him that the Guild is ultimately a force for good within the city.
metadata.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_AReCon: oe Guildhall_ZhentBetrayalTeleport to S_LOW_Guildhall_NineFingers_ef1b7a12-6439-470a-885c-fa47851728cd and save Nine fingers from the ZhentCOM: Talk to S_LOW_Guildhall_NineFingers_ef1b7a12-6439-470a-885c-fa47851728cd with Minsc present and in your party.

50.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
50.text: Kind of you to take the Zhentarim down first, but that doesn't make us friends.
50.context: NodeContext: Just after one battle but her blood is up now and she's ready for us to attack - urging us to do it

60.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
60.text: Come on then, Stone Lord - if you mean to take my chair, you'll get no better chance than this.
60.context: NodeContext: Just after one battle but her blood is up now and she's ready for us to attack - urging us to do it

68.speaker: Minsc
68.text: Minsc has no interest in your furniture, Nine-Fingers - only in the wicked rump that fills it!
68.context: NodeContext: Stressing that he's Minsc and not the Stone Lord

22.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
22.context: NodeContext: Bemusement cutting through her bloodlust for a moment

46.speaker: Minsc
46.text: You have been a stone in this city's boot for too long. And it will be no Stone Lord who reaches 'twixt Balduran's sticky toes to dislodge you - it will be Minsc!
46.context: NodeContext: Powering through, oblivious of Nine-Fingers' confusion

86.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
86.text: I haven't got the slightest idea what he's trying to say.
86.context: NodeContext: shrugging at the player, start contrast to Minsc' grand pronouncements

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Proof that he is back to normal, no?
20.context: NodeContext: to player, finally clicking that Minsc is back to himself

65.speaker: Jaheira
65.text: Proof that he is back to normal, no?
65.context: NodeContext: to player, finally clicking that Minsc is back to himself

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Minsc, calm down. The battle is over.
13.context: NodeContext: to player, finally clicking that Minsc is back to himself

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Minsc, calm down. The battle is over.
18.context: NodeContext: to player, finally clicking that Minsc is back to himself

41.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
41.text: So the hound answers to his name again, does he? And you didn't have to put him down.
41.context: NodeContext: to player, finally clicking that Minsc is back to himself

51.speaker: Player
51.text: He's been like this ever since I knocked some sense back into him.
51.context: NodeContext: In response to player saying they knocked sense into Minsc - but satisfied

16.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
16.text: You might have knocked it out. But a good thing you did - he's more like his old self again.
16.context: NodeContext: In response to player saying they knocked sense into Minsc - but satisfied

9.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
9.text: Good. I'd rather you die as Minsc the mad Rashemaar. It's silly, but - d'you know you were something of a hero of mine, when I was young?
9.context: NodeContext: To Minsc. Not sentimental, just stating a curious fact before we get to the killing. Amusement at herself on the second line.

29.speaker: Minsc
29.text: Even now, your tongue twists the truth. When you were young and ten-fingered still, Minsc and Boo were stone - enstatuated on a city square!
29.context: NodeContext: Scornful, thinking Nine-Fingers is just trying to lie to him in order to be spared

5.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
5.text: Aye, I remember the spot - by a garden on the Wide. A soft thicket near the market, with ample pockets to pick. Celestia itself, to a street rat looking for shelter.
5.context: NodeContext: Wry and rueful, remembering it with fond amusement - Nine-Fingers was abducted as a child and, even after being ransomed, left her family to fend for herself. She doesn't speak of her traumatic past with any great pathos - she's seen worse in the city.

40.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
40.text: You might not have been wrestling monsters, but... you kept the wind and the rain off. Heroic enough for me.
40.context: NodeContext: Shrug - again denying any sentimentality, just stating facts.

14.speaker: Minsc
14.text: ...bah! You try to dampen Boo's eyes. Do not think you will be spared his teeth! Evil is evil, even if it once was... innocent.
14.context: NodeContext: Emotional at the story and pouring it all into his denial instead. His loudness is proportional to his depth of feeling.

35.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
35.text: Oh, I'm no innocent. But evil? You tell me. With the Fist, the watch,  and the Council itself all licking the Absolute's boots, who's the only one left standing to protect Baldur's Gate?
35.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, not buying Minsc's black and white. She's fervent proud about the Guild's place as the city's true defender, and won't be told otherwise

17.speaker: Player
17.text: She's right, Minsc. She's been an ally down through the years. A friend, even.
17.context: NodeContext: Still ready to fight and kill Minsc - not letting him off the hook for what he's done

19.speaker: Jaheira
19.text: She's right, Minsc. She's been an ally down through the years. A friend, even.
19.context: NodeContext: Still ready to fight and kill Minsc - not letting him off the hook for what he's done

62.speaker: Minsc
62.text: A friend? Jaheira, Boo cannot believe his ears! Has the city fallen so far in our absence? Are there no heroes left?
62.context: NodeContext: Still ready to fight and kill Minsc - not letting him off the hook for what he's done

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Heroes come and go, but the Guild has always been here, protecting the city. Until the Stone Lord came to break us.
6.context: NodeContext: Still ready to fight and kill Minsc - not letting him off the hook for what he's done

67.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
67.text: Heroes come and go, but the Guild has always been here, protecting the city. Until the Stone Lord came to break us.
67.context: NodeContext: Still ready to fight and kill Minsc - not letting him off the hook for what he's done

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Well, ranger? You cannot always leave it up to your wychlaran. Make a choice.
96.context: NodeContext: 'Heh' is not a laugh so much as a quiet grunt of acknowledgement. He's coming around, and knows he has to listen

89.text: Heh. Jaheira says she is no wychlaran. Perhaps not. But if she says I should not honour, defend, and listen to her... it is the only time she has ever been wrong.
89.context: NodeContext: 'Heh' is not a laugh so much as a quiet grunt of acknowledgement. He's coming around, and knows he has to listen

44.speaker: Minsc
44.text: Heh. Jaheira says she is no wychlaran. Perhaps not. But if she says I should not honour, defend, and listen to her... it is the only time she has ever been wrong.
44.context: NodeContext: 'Heh' is not a laugh so much as a quiet grunt of acknowledgement. He's coming around, and knows he has to listen

81.speaker: Minsc
81.text: If she trusts in Nine-Fingers - if you do - then so will Minsc. But that means, the things Minsc has done...

31.speaker: Player
31.text: If you can't tell ally from enemy, Minsc, maybe you're no hero at all.
31.context:
NodeContext: Quietly devastated (or quietly for Minsc)
He's seeing how much damage he did as the Stone Lord, and declaring himself ny-DESH-kah - 'Blunt Blade' in Rashemi custom, a berserker who cannot be trusted to fight alongside his friends, and so is given a blunt blade in order to do no harm.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: She's right. The Guild will fight for the city - we just have to let them.
37.context:
NodeContext: Quietly devastated (or quietly for Minsc)
He's seeing how much damage he did as the Stone Lord, and declaring himself ny-DESH-kah - 'Blunt Blade' in Rashemi custom, a berserker who cannot be trusted to fight alongside his friends, and so is given a blunt blade in order to do no harm.

80.speaker: Minsc
80.text: ...I am shamed. Nydeshka, unworthy to fight alongside my friends! Boo - what am I to do?
80.context:
NodeContext: Quietly devastated (or quietly for Minsc)
He's seeing how much damage he did as the Stone Lord, and declaring himself ny-DESH-kah - 'Blunt Blade' in Rashemi custom, a berserker who cannot be trusted to fight alongside his friends, and so is given a blunt blade in order to do no harm.

82.speaker: Minsc
82.text: ...I am shamed. Nydeshka, unworthy to fight alongside my friends! Boo - what am I to do?
82.context:
NodeContext: Quietly devastated (or quietly for Minsc)
He's seeing how much damage he did as the Stone Lord, and declaring himself ny-DESH-kah - 'Blunt Blade' in Rashemi custom, a berserker who cannot be trusted to fight alongside his friends, and so is given a blunt blade in order to do no harm.

57.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
57.text: I can't speak for your rodent, but I know something of debts. If you reckon you've got one to repay... well, we could always work together.
57.context: NodeContext: Broaching the topic - attempting an olive branch

28.speaker: Minsc
28.text: With you? Minsc has no lust for gold, that he would shake grandmothers by their ankles, or set Boo nibbling at their purse-strings!
28.context: NodeContext: Indignant at the idea of joining the Guild

72.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
72.text: I'm not talking about that. We've both got bigger enemies than one another - the city's enemies.

32.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
32.text: And, Tyr's honest truth... you gave my Guild the wake-up call it needed. We've grown complacent, lazy. Too sure of our standing.

56.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
56.text: We never would've needed the Zhent if we'd had a fighting force of our own. Swords for the city, when the watch and Fist fail us.
56.context: NodeContext: Convincing Minsc he could be a force for good - it should be an open question whether she's sincere or not, not obviously cunning or overly earnest. 'Sure, why not?'

7.speaker: Minsc
7.text: Like a berserker lodge of my homeland. No army or militia, serving the local lords - but heroes, working for the common good!
7.context: NodeContext: Dawning, gaining enthusiasm at the idea

75.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
75.context: NodeContext: Not quite how she'd have phrased it

43.speaker: Minsc
43.text: Very well - Minsc and Boo accept!
43.context: NodeContext: Enthusiasm dissipating to dejection again. Genuine, quiet doubt - not melodramatic

53.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
53.context: NodeContext: Enthusiasm dissipating to dejection again. Genuine, quiet doubt - not melodramatic

92.speaker: Minsc
92.text: Boo and I will be your berserker lodge, taking the ugly ways of your Guild and beating them into a more virtuous shape!
92.context: NodeContext: Enthusiasm dissipating to dejection again. Genuine, quiet doubt - not melodramatic

78.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
78.text: That's... not even slightly what I was saying. I wasn't asking -
78.context: NodeContext: Enthusiasm dissipating to dejection again. Genuine, quiet doubt - not melodramatic

8.speaker: Minsc
8.text: You are right - I have proven myself unworthy. I cannot serve the city if I was so easily turned against it. If I do not know my own mind... perhaps I no longer know what is good.
8.context: NodeContext: Enthusiasm dissipating to dejection again. Genuine, quiet doubt - not melodramatic

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Simple, then. Trust that Boo will guide you both.

93.speaker: Minsc
93.text: Boo. Kingpin Boo! My friend - your wisdom is vast and unknowable as the Rashemi High Country!

34.speaker: Minsc
34.text: What say you, Boo? When the Absolute is slain, shall we join Nine-Fingers Keene and show her the ways of goodness?
34.context: NodeContext: Amused, enjoying how even Nine-Fingers can't rein Minsc in when he gets going

55.speaker: Player
55.text: You did say he was your hero, Astele. Maybe you'll learn something.
55.context: NodeContext: Amused, enjoying how even Nine-Fingers can't rein Minsc in when he gets going

63.speaker: Jaheira
63.text: You did say he was your hero, Astele. Maybe you'll learn something.
63.context: NodeContext: Amused, enjoying how even Nine-Fingers can't rein Minsc in when he gets going

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Can't we just go back to killing one another instead?

24.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
24.text: Can't we just go back to killing one another instead?

49.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
49.text: ...All right. Fine. Let's leave this particular fight for when the actual war is won, shall we?

42.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
42.text: With the Stone Lord off my back, I'll be able bring my people out of hiding. Cobble together a force so we're ready when you call on us.

61.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
61.text: You have my thanks. Though I'm still not actually sure you haven't made my life that little bit harder.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Minsc, I'm fairly certain that 'good' is literally the only thing you do know.
90.context: NodeContext: Not getting that we may have just insulted him

79.speaker: Minsc
79.text: My friend, I am touched by your kind words. And now I must be equal to them!
79.context: NodeContext: Not getting that we may have just insulted him

15.speaker: Player
15.text: You have nothing to prove to her. You don't belong in the Guild.
15.context: NodeContext: Nodding, assuming a more grave tone - the matter is shelved for now, and he and 9F might well go back to fighting when all of this is done.

38.speaker: Minsc
38.text: You have planted a burr in my brain, guildmaster. Once I have dislodged the worm and redeemed myself in my hamster's eyes... we will return to this matter.
38.context: NodeContext: Nodding, assuming a more grave tone - the matter is shelved for now, and he and 9F might well go back to fighting when all of this is done.

4.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
4.text: My door is always open. Stone Lord.
4.context: NodeContext: Agreeing to the truce for now, but should contain a hint of threat. Calling him Stone Lord is a reminder that they're not friends.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: We need to focus on the Absolute. You can negotiate your alliance afterwards.

23.text: No. Minsc has not always done what is right - but evil is evil. It is a choice - and Nine-Fingers made hers a long time ago.
23.context: NodeContext: At a loss - wanting to keep the peace between them but knowing it's going to come to blows.

30.speaker: Minsc
30.text: No. Minsc has not always done what is right - but evil is evil. It is a choice - and Nine-Fingers made hers a long time ago.
30.context: NodeContext: At a loss - wanting to keep the peace between them but knowing it's going to come to blows.

36.speaker: Minsc
36.text: That story you told... if it be true, then... I am sorry I could not save you then.
36.context: NodeContext: At a loss - wanting to keep the peace between them but knowing it's going to come to blows.

71.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
71.text: Oh, you fool. I didn't need saving - from you, or anyone else. But - I suppose I'm sorry, too.
71.context: NodeContext: At a loss - wanting to keep the peace between them but knowing it's going to come to blows.

12.speaker: Player
12.context: NodeContext: At a loss - wanting to keep the peace between them but knowing it's going to come to blows.

25.speaker: Jaheira
25.context: NodeContext: At a loss - wanting to keep the peace between them but knowing it's going to come to blows.

11.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
11.text: You tried, Harper. Don't worry - I never expected you'd let your friend die without a fight. That's one of the reasons I liked you.
11.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, pragmatic - she genuinely likes and respects Jaheira, but knows that if Minsc dies, so must she. Won't hold it against Jaheira for trying to kill her in return, it's inevitable.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: History will remember the Stone Lord as far worse a villain than Nine-Fingers. Don't make it worse.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Enough, Nine-Fingers. Minsc has been manipulated enough.

74.speaker: Minsc
74.text: Yes. I may not be able to trust my mind, but I trust my friend. Evil is evil - it is a choice and you made yours a long time ago.

91.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
91.text: I'm confused, if that counts. But if he no longer answers to Stone Lord...

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Explain it all - the tadpole, the Absolute, his time as the Stone Lord.
64.context: NodeContext: Knows she should doubt our story, but doesn't

54.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
54.text: The some sorry tale as yours, then? Bizarre as it is - it explains how this idiot wound up serving the Dead Three.
54.context: NodeContext: Knows she should doubt our story, but doesn't

94.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
94.text: A bizarre tale - but it fits this idiot, somehow. But if he's back to himself...

66.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
66.text: The Zhent are down - just you and me now, Stone Lord. So if you mean to take my chair, you'll get no better chance than this.
66.context: NodeContext: Just after one battle but her blood is up now and she's ready for us to attack - urging us to do it
